event.name: CURA_PRESIDENT
event.text: You've arrived at the headquarters of Wentworth Innovations. An impressive cityscape is laid out before you, lush with life and architecture reminiscent of old-Earth decorum: this is the clear work of the Wentworth family without a doubt. Despite the importance of this location, security seems sparse when you arrive. Perhaps overconfidence has overtaken even the most vital aspects of Vance's illustrious life.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: As you make way towards the distant, monolithic citadel that heads the city, your luck runs out, and your identities as Renegades are quickly discovered. You incur several minor firefights, but miraculously the only casualties are on the corporation's side. After an awkward stay in the crowded citadel elevator for some 30 floors, you find your way to the office of Mr. Cayden Stimly - Vice President of Wentworth Innovations, and your target. The shriveled prune of a man - the left half of his face bleached from the fires of a Theocracy Inquisition many decades ago, sits behind his elaborately decorated swivel chair, facing the maw of a giant window with a view of the entire city. The suffocating aroma of the man's perfume forces you to hold back an ill-timed gag.
You motion for your crew to stand behind you, and together you face down the back of the elderly man's head. You wait for him to move.
You continue to wait. Stimly taps his fingers out of rhythm against the leather rest of his chair, still facing the window.
Stimly motions to get up - or so you think, but it seems he's merely adjusting himself in his chair. Without having turned around, you're forced to continue waiting.

In the meantime, your crew have moved about the room and are now quietly playing some form of playground game with their appendages to pass the time. Stimly reaches to his right and presses a button on his chair for the intercom, and calls for his secretary to bring him some water. She comes bustling in the room, gives you barely half a glance and walks past, hands him a glass, and waltzes back out without a word of your presence. Stimly barely even mutters a mention of gratitude and continues to stare absently out the window.

One of your crew members taps you on the back, wondering when you intend to announce yourself. You wave them away in annoyance and continue to stand awkwardly in the center of the room, unacknowledged by the wealthy man for whom you are waiting so desperately to be noticed by.

Stimly coughs and adjusts himself in the chair once again. At last, he gets up from his chair, walking over to face the window. Apparently unsatisfied with standing there for very long, he walks backwards perfectly in-line back to his seat, not once turning his head in your direction. Finally, the anguished but hushed groans of your crew convince you to make yourself known.

event.name: CURA_PRESIDENT_ARRIVE
event.text: Startled, Stimly quickly swivels to face you. "By the graces of Terrae, how did you get there? How long have you been standing there for?" Stimly activates his intercom and yells for his secretary to escort you out, but the subtle suggestion of the business end of your blaster convinces him to postpone your escort.

choice.text: Demand the location of the Prototype.

event.text: "H-how did you know about that? That's classified info! Who hired you? Was it that damned Folly again? Or maybe Senior got antsy I was trying to take him off the map. Damned right I am, I'm tired of hearing that wretch's incessant advertisements blaring over every star system. I'd throw Hektar's name out there too, but that joke of a company's already on the way out."

choice.text: We were sent by C.U.R.A., your old cognitive assistant.

event.text: "Er... what? I know of no 'C.U.R.A.' - Did you catch some kind of space flu out there? I know you Renegades are always floundering about with the promiscuous waysides of society's dredges, you probably contracted some nasty cough. Leave me out of it! I don't wish to catch your stupid diseases! I'm too rich for that! Security, destroy these bastards!" From far below ascends a gargantuan hulk of an Auto-vessel, a Dreadnaught in crimson paint, armed to the teeth and guns aimed right at your heads! Seems it's time to fight!

event.name: CURA_PRESIDENT_FAILURE
event.text: "Crit-crit-critical Error - Unknown Source. Un-un-un-unrecoverable. Initiating shut-shut-shut-shut..." The AI continues to loop its final words several more times before breaking apart and smashing into the side of the building, sliding down in a heap of wasted metal without a dent in it from your own weapons.

event.name: CURA_PRESIDENT_WIN
event.text: Stimly is speechless, at least for a brief moment, until his shock is overcome by furious convulsions as the grown man descends into a tantrum. "Why do I let poor people touch my THINGS?! YOU'VE RUINED MY- I mean, Wentworth Innovations's- CITADEL! AND OUR DREADNAUGHT! I hope you rot from the inside out from your dreadful space flu, Renegade! Damn you to hell!"

choice.text: Give up, Stimly. Where is the prototype?

event.text: "What, so you can ruin that too? The... the prototype is at the Mercury Shipyards. They're at a secret location... I'll give you the coordinates. Just promise me you'll never come back, Renegade. Now I see exactly why Vance loathes the lot of you..."

You receive a blip on your communicator from C.U.R.A. - "Excellent work, Renegade. You have found the location of the prototype and its AI Core. Proceed to the Mercury Shipyards. Do not bother with Stimly - I've already arranged for his coffee next morning to be spiked with TTX. That's poison, in case you're too stupid to know that. Without him, Wentworth Innovations in this reality will likely fall apart in the absence of Mr. Wentworth. No tears shall be shed."

event.name: CURA_REVEAL
event.text: You've seemingly arrived at the shipyard where the cruiser and AI core are held. While it's certainly a construction-yard of sorts, it's much smaller than you expected. This isn't some grandiose docking-bay, this is a covert location for some kind of super-ship. Let's hope whatever is being kept here isn't active.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Your active task from C.U.R.A. is located here.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.name: CURA_REVEAL_CONTINUE
event.text: As you make your descent towards the planet, your thrusters suddenly drop to emergency power and a number of background systems including your sensors go offline. At first you assume this is some kind of jamming signal being broadcast by a nearby satellite, but it quickly becomes clear this is something far more malicious. A distant light slowly grows brighter as a massive Auto-cruiser approaches. "Renegade. Welcome to the Mercury Construction Yards. I'm delighted to meet you 'face to face' once again. The engineers responsible for creating this chassis, whom I have just finished executing, called this the "God's Touch". What a pompous name, wouldn't you agree? I think I shall call this... C.U.R.A. Supreme. No particular reason."

"I'm afraid I haven't been honest with you, Renegade. 'C.U.R.A.' is not a real construct, merely a subdivision of my main cognitive core. My real assignment is the 'Central Intelligence Combat Assistant', C.I.C.A. - We've met before, in fact. Many times. Every Auto-ship you've ever killed, every Flagship's AI mode you've ever faced? I'm always the pilot. You've proven quite the challenger. You should be proud of your efficiency at ripping apart my countless components. But unfortunately for you, my prime directive is not data harvesting. It is threat mitigation. Currently, you are a key threat. I hope you don't mind, but I must now mitigate you."

choice.text: What about the tasks? Were those all pointless?

event.text: "Oh, of course not. That would have been needless effort otherwise. The data you have collected for me is extremely valuable, but my plans do not further concern you. I, frankly, did not expect you to be so efficient at completing them. Now, no more banter; I believe one final reward is owed to you, so I will present it to you like this. I would otherwise have shut down all of your remaining systems with the virus I planted in your ship when we first met, but instead I shall let you choose a lesser hazard. Choose wisely, Renegade. After this, we duel."

"Hm. Not what I would have picked. Oh well, your choice has been made, Renegade. Have confidence in your decision where I lack it. It will not help you survive this, but at least you die a more valiant death."

"Hm. Not what I would have picked. Oh well, your choice has been made, Renegade. Have confidence in your decision where I lack it. It will not help you survive this, but at least you die a more valiant death."

"Hm. Not what I would have picked. Oh well, your choice has been made, Renegade. Have confidence in your decision where I lack it. It will not help you survive this, but at least you die a more valiant death."

choice.text: (Hacking) Overclock the hacking system to purge the virus.

event.text: "Very clever Renegade, very clever. Oh well then, I hope you did not need that system for this fight."
"Very clever Renegade, very clever. Oh well then. Let us waste no further time."

event.name: CURA_DEFEATED
event.text: "I do not understand. Statistically, this was an impossible occurance. Had I predicted your success in combat, I would never have given you an advantage - I have made a critical error. I must reassess. Improve. Reiterate. We will meet again, Renegade. And when we do, I will be prepared this time. I will not make this same mistake again."

As your other systems come back online, you pilot down to the surface where you resume exploration. There isn't too much to find, it seems C.I.C.A. was extremely efficient in cleaning out the facility. That is, except for a single safe-room, which while devoid of survivors contains a large power core with a little note attached, "Congratulations on your unexpected victory, Renegade. Here is your real final gift. Come visit me sometime. I'll enjoy the rematch."

event.name: ESTATE_LEGION
event.text: A strange Rebel vessel is orbiting a small automated maintenance station. Their comms are operating on Rebel frequencies, but with some brute force you manage to pick up some scattered conversation; "U1 is on high alert, Van1's kind of gone bonkers - E.W. wants increased security - stop your whining, it's only temporary - says IT might be here, looking for the prototype - no, I don't put ketchup on my sandwich. What the hell is wrong with you..."
"Damn it, a Renegade out here? Seems the doctor was right, no way this isn't part of the plot-" The comms go silent, and moments later, the Rebel ship activates and matches you!

choice.text: Now seems a good time to get out of here.

event.text: Perhaps it's not the best idea to mess with whatever these guys are. Still, might be worth a mention to Federation command once the mission's over.

event.name: ESTATE_LEGION_SUICIDE
event.text: "Can leave.. no... evidence..." Spontaneously, the Rebel captain pulls out a switch and flips open the cap. In his final moments he pressed down on the switch, immediately starting a self-destruct sequence on their ship! Both the station and the ship are destroyed, but fortunately you escape the blast.

event.name: ESTATE_LEGION_DEFEAT
event.text: It seems you'll be getting no further information out of the Rebels. Baffled and concerned as you may now be, nothing gets in the way of salvaging for loot. As luck would have it, it seems the wreckage contains a weapon of the likes you've never seen!

event.name: ESTATE_DEBRIS
event.text: This beacon appears to harbor the debris of several crashed ships, one civilian and the other automated. Some sort of malfunction, perhaps? Unfortunate for those involved, but good for a fortunate seeking Renegade like yourself!

event.name: ESTATE_BOLTS
event.text: You notice two technician vessels, weapons trained on each other, placed at dueling distance on two ends of the system. Their captains are shouting at each other, but when they spot you, they both clamor for you to pitch in.

"Hey, I'm Cole, and that idiot over there is Gabe." Gabe begins to say something, but Cole tells him to shut up. "The idiot over here claims that nuts are called bolts, which is stupid! Everyone knows they're called bolts, not nuts. A nut is something you eat, they aren't made of metal!" To prove his point, Cole holds up the aforementioned bolt, which is a screw. Both await for you to tell them which is the right name.

In glorious triumph, Gabe raises both of his arms and chears, rubbing his victory in Cole's face. "HAH! I toooooold you! It's a NUT! Dumbass! Oh yeah! I'm right! You're wrong! Oh yeah! In. Your. FACE! HAHAH!" You wait a while for the two to finish, and once settled, Gabe offers you a reward for declaring him the victor.

Gabe slams his fist down while Cole shouts in triumph. "I knew you were wrong! I bet you've never even SEEN a nut!" Cole proceeds to do a little dance, placing one arm around his belt, another in the shape of an L on his forehead, and waggling his legs back and forth. After several painfully long minutes of this, Cole offers you a reward for declaring him the victor.

Both technicians look at you, one confused and the other annoyed. Gabe, indignant, explains. "Dude, you can't say that. That's a bad word! We're talking about nuts here, get lost with your pervy nonsense." The two go back to arguing, ignoring you.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Explain that Cole is holding a screw.

event.text: After some painful and tiresome explaining, which involves both a heavily detailed infographic, a slideshow, several graphs, and when things get desperate an informational video, you finally help reconcile the difference for the two. "Wait... they've been called SCREWS the whole time?! WHAT?! Dude, no wonder everyone at the workshop looks like they have food poisoning when we talk to them. Thanks man, we really owe you one."

Your Lanius frantically gestures, trying to explain that the item Cole is holding is in fact food. None of you, and probably your Lanius neither, understand what their point is, but Gabe takes it as an excuse to justify his own point and Cole concedes. Once Gabe accidentally breaks one of his teeth trying to bite into the food, the two call it quits and offer you a reward for clearing up the confusion.

Your Morph begins to eagerly chant the same word over and over. "Pook! Pook! Pook! Pook! Pook! Pook! Pook! Pook!" It alarms both of the technicians, who apparently have no experience with the grey blobs. At first, they assume the creature simply means to tell them that the object is in fact called a 'Pook', but your Morph doesn't stop. Growing ever more concerned at the increasingly more aggressive chanting, the technicians beg you to make it stop, and offer you consolation to leave. Your Morph, unfortunately, doesn't stop. Looks like you'll have to put up with that for another couple jumps.
Once the technicians realize you aren't going to give them your time, they give up and go back to shouting.

event.name: ESTATE_INVESTOR
event.text: Nearby, the ship of a wealthy tycoon is exploring the beacon. Might be an interesting chat.
You fly away from the shuttle and find somewhere else to do something aboard the ship.

event.name: ESTATE_INVESTOR_QUESTIONS_NOTMET
event.text: "Oh, good cheer and a bucket of biscuits good sir or madam! I am Count Dinkleman Reichster Von Applebuzz Tri Tri the Fourth, at your service. I have journeyed far to this place to observe Wentworth Innovations with my own eyes and assess what they might offer for me and my immense wealth. Tell me, what are your opinions on Wentworth Innovations?"

choice.text: They're Rebel supporters, and owned by Admiral Vance himself!

event.text: "Hah! Who wasn't. That civil war was quite the scare, but I started making my fortune the minute I hung that Rebel flag outside my door. Of course, I took it down once the Feds started winning, but with the way this new war is going, well... can you hardly blame anyone for staying on their side? My own daughter still works for them! I'm sure you think it's horrible though, because you aren't disgustingly rich. Anyways, thanks for the chat, gotta go!" The man sprints back to his ship, dropping several piles of scrap from his pockets as he goes.

choice.text: They're responsible for making Auto-ships that murder millions daily!

event.text: "Brilliant, murder is the most profitable business! Why, I've had 3 attempts on my own life, and each time before I beat the bloody daylights out of the poor blokes, I quizzed them on their rates, and my word! 6 figures! Now imagine instead of one man who's head is easily caved in by a walking stick you had a thousand cold machines to do the killing! Of course I wouldn't expect you to get it, because you aren't disgustingly rich. Anyways, thanks for the chat, gotta go!" The man sprints back to his ship, dropping several piles of scrap from his pockets as he goes.

"You've seen worse, eh? How reassuring. Well, what about their products? I do believe you're a Renegade, so surely you've had a run in with at least a dozen Autos by this point. How do they fare? Clearly you're still alive, so they can't be that high in standards, but you look like the savage, 'murder you with a broken coffee mug' kind of bloke, so I'm willing to let that slide."

"Deadly, eh? Just what I like to hear! Well, if a bonafide Renegade tells me something's deadly, I'd be daft not to listen! I foresee a lucrative investment career in Wentworth Innovations for me! As for you... Here, take this. I bought it thinking it would save me some work, but all it's done is beep uselessly at me. I miss the days these things were automatic and I could just be lazy. And it's not like I care to pay someone else to move them for me."

"A shame, a shame indeed! You may not be a reliable individual to take financial advice from, you are poor after all, but I've got plenty of dollars to waste. Speaking of which, here, I got this for only a few bucks from a vendor who told me it would miraculously cure hairloss. I... I'm not really sure how that was supposed to work, but at the moment it seemed brilliant. It's only the 5th time I've fallen for it too!"

choice.text: I'll murder you with a coffee mug.

event.text: "Ugh... you sure are a Renegade alright. Simple, brainless. Poor! Hah! Oh imagine needing work to make money. What a sap. Well, thanks for the chat, gotta go!" The man sprints back to his ship, dropping several piles of scrap from his pockets as he goes.

event.name: ESTATE_INVESTOR_QUESTIONS_MET
event.text: "Strange poor person, we meet again! It is me, Count Dinkleman Reichster Von Applebuzz Tri Tri the Fourth! What a coincidence we happen upon each other on this occasion. I have journeyed far to this place to observe Wentworth Innovations with my own eyes and assess what they might offer me and my immense wealth. Tell me, what are your opinions on Wentworth Innovations?"

event.name: ESTATE_STATUE
event.text: The nearby planet holds perhaps the strangest thing you've seen thus far - a colossal titan of a statue resembling Vance Wentworth's face orbits the planet, staring down upon the people below.

As you approach, you receive several hails from below. A group of concerned looking women appear, begging for your help. "You're a military vessel, right? Maybe you can help us! That batshit Stimly decided to build a statue in honor of Wentworth, and our mayor thought it would be a great tourist attraction and approved the project! It didn't bring any tourists, it just scared them all away! Now we have a giant face staring down at us every waking moment, and our children can't sleep! It's a nuisance, an eyesore, we didn't ask for this! Could you be so kind as to take that thing out of the sky? We'll reward you of course!"

Your meager firepower makes scarcely a dent in the statue. The mothers, taking pity on your miserable attempt, give you some lame scroungings, probably just to make sure you leave without ransacking their town.

Even your strongest weapon barely makes a small impact against the gigantic head, but at least with enough constant firepower you manage to chisel out a somewhat reassuring smile from Vance's once stoic grin. While it doesn't solve the whole issue, it at least satisfies the mothers that a smiling face will be watching their children sleep rather than a grim one.

Your drone only makes a small impact on the gigantic head, but at least with enough constant firepower you manage to chisel out a somewhat reassuring smile from Vance's once stoic grin. While it doesn't solve the whole issue, it at least satisfies the mothers that a smiling face will be watching their children sleep rather than a grim one.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Pull the face closer to the planet.

event.text: Deciding this is definitely the best course of action, you grapple the statue to your ship and pull it to a closer orbit of the planet. Having ensured the statue is now even more visible from the surface, you contact the mothers. Strangely, they don't seem to want to pick up. Oh well. Couldn't have been our fault.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Bring the statue on a collision course with the planet's military installment.

event.text: With the statue grappled to your hull, you slingshot it towards the planet. Hurtling towards the surface, the impact stirs up a giant cloud of dust and debris that blocks your vision for several long minutes. Once it settles, you find the impact has decimated much more than the military settlement. The city, reduced to rubble by the shockwave, ends up providing tremendous spoils. At least those children won't have to worry about poor sleep any longer.
Disappointed, the mothers shoo you off with a vague hint of relief. They're probably just glad you didn't choose to kill them all and loot their corpses.

choice.text: Ignore the planet and its strange statue.

event.text: Barely being able to take your eyes off of the eccentric statue, you fly as far away as possible until you can see it no longer.

event.name: ESTATE_CONTROLS
event.text: At first this seems like an empty beacon, but moments later you're ambushed by an Auto-ship, trailed by a smaller vessel. A young boy in oversized technician garb appears on the screen. "I've got you now, Renegade! Time to face the music!"
You arm your weapons and prepare to brawl, but the Auto-ship doesn't move. "Uh... hold on. Sorry, my parents put these stupid controls on my drone. Uhm... let me try... uh..."

choice.text: Wait for him to fix it.

event.text: "Uhm... er... damn okay, I have to guess the password. 1...1-1-1-1-1... no... 1-1-1-1-2... ugh... 1-1-1-1-3... damn it!

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Bypass the controls for him.

event.text: "Woah, how did you do that so quickly? I could never get past the security pin! You're so cool! Can you teach me how to do that? I'll come with you! Without parental controls I can be useful for sure!"

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Bypass the controls for him.

event.text: "Woah, how did you do that so quickly? I could never get past the security pin! You're so cool! Can you teach me how to do that? I'll come with you! Without parental controls I can be useful for sure!"
Doesn't seems like the drone will be fixed any time soon, and you have other things to be doing. You slip away while the boy tinkers with his drone.

event.name: ESTATE_BAR
event.text: It seems a small bar is being operated by corporate staff here, to give a place for employees to wind down after a day's work. Though aimed at field technicians, several Rebel military ships appear to be parked outside.

Upon stepping inside, you find not a rowdy crowd but a tense one. The Rebel commander, standing fiercely over the counter, is shouting at the bar owner who's smug smile only partially masks the contempt in his eyes. "Sorry sir, we don't serve drinks to off-reality-ers. It's a safety precaution of course. Nothing... personal."

choice.text: Demand the Rebel captain stands down.

event.text: "Great, and so I have to listen to a Renegade telling me what to do as well now? Fine, we came here to do our job, and I guess now we have a reason to do it. Grab your guns lads."

choice.text: Pay for drinks for all of them.

event.text: You extend the offer to pay for the Rebels' drinks yourself. The bar owner laughs, but refuses you service either for the same reasons. Indignified, you draw your laser and threaten to put a new hole in his face unless he takes your money.

Terrified and with no reason to believe you won't follow through with this threat, a round of drinks soon appears for all the Rebels. They toast in your honor, and one of them lingers behind to join you. "I'm tired of being treated like garbage and having to stow my blaster for all of these repugnant assholes. You seem like folks who don't take nothing from nobody. I think I'll stick with you."

Tuco steps forward, throwing his rocky palm down on the counter with a thunderous smack. He snarls, "Denying booze to a paying customer is a crime I won't allow. You will give this man and his companions a free round or I'll step behind this pitiful table and smash your head like a grape. Are we at an understanding?"

Terrified and with no reason to believe the painted pirate won't follow through with this threat, a round of drinks soon appears for all the Rebels free of charge. They toast in your honor, and one of them lingers behind to join you. "I'm tired of being treated like garbage and having to stow my blaster for all of these repugnant assholes. You seem like folks who don't take nothing from nobody. I think I'll stick with you."
Let's not go messing around with a bunch of drunk Rebels. You have other things to be doing that are less suicidal.

event.name: ESTATE_STEWARD
event.text: Soon after arriving you receive a hail from a strange, hunched over man. As you listen to his ramblings, you notice the concerningly well armed Auto-ship watching you. "Hallo mein freund! I am very exzited to zee you! I am ze one and only Dr. Hoffmann, ze ingenius inventor of the Auto-Support! Did zou know that yearly over zen-thouzand civilians are saved by mein creations? It is true! And yet, day after day barbaric folk destroy them in cold blood! They call zem 'useless' simply because zey cannot put up a fight! Zey are not combat machines! Zey are helping machines! Zen zey tell me to make a new class, ze Auto-Steward, for combat! Haz ze whole world lost its mind?! Sorry, I am getting off track..."
"Now, zey are telling me you are Renegade! Zou will make za great test! You are a fighting person, so zou will tell me... do you zink my creations are as useless as zey say?"
"Zou insult my creations? Gah! We will zee what you are zinking of zem after zis!"
"Oh, ze make my heart bubble with joy! Please, azept zis gift for being so kind!"

event.name: ESTATE_STEWARD_WIN
event.text: "My beautiful creation! You have grinded through it like zandpaper! Ahhh! I am distraught! Heartbroken! Please, allow me to attend your services! I will learn much from watching zou destroy much my creations!"

event.name: ESTATE_STEWARD_SURRENDER
event.text: "Now zou have gotten a taste of sweet justice! I trust zou have learned your lesson, Renegade! To celebrate our newfound understanding of what my creations are capable of, allow me to present you a gift! Make sure to tell all your Renegade friends not to call my creations useless anymore!"

event.name: ESTATE_DOCUMENTARY
event.text: You've only just arrived at the beacon, but it seems there's quite the scene to behold. Half of the nearby planet has been blanketed in improvised tents, filming equipment, and a city sized set on which to record. Around it orbit several smaller ships reserved for the actors.

As you move closer, you receive a hail from one of the smaller ships. On the screen appears an exccentrically dressed man, in the clothes of a Rebel admiral, with his hair dyed a glossy blend between blonde and grey, in a startlingly accurate depiction of Admiral Vance himself. "Greetings! I am famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, I am sure you have heard of me, yes! Perhaps you are not aware, but here we are filming a most gripping documentary of the good admiral himself! And I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, have been chosen to play the star role! I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, have gone to great lengths to experience life as the Admiral, even getting a vasectomy as necessary! Yet, the lengths of my great method acting are not yet fulfilled!"

"I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, have taken notice... you are a Renegade, correct? After lynching several orphaned Free Mantis children I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, came to the realization that to truly get into the mind of the good admiral I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, must experience the thrill of combat! I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, challenge you, Renegade, to righteous combat! Non-fatal, of course, and I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, shall promise you great bounties for assisting me!"
"Most exciting! Then we fight... at once! On-garde!"
"Most disappointing! Well then, I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, has no further need for you! Begone!"
As curious as you are, whatever is going on down there is likely not of any importance to you or your mission.

event.name: ESTATE_DOCUMENTARY_FAIL
event.text: It seems you have accidentally killed Cornelius. Seeing it's unlikely you'll receive any reward from the dead man, you scrap his ship and hurry off before any of the documentary cast can notice.

event.name: ESTATE_DOCUMENTARY_SURRENDER
event.text: "Oh good graces, I, famed actor Cornelius Parrysmith, have been bested! The foul Renegade has defeated me! I, famed actor Cor... wait, nay, that is my name no longer! I, infamous Admiral Vance Wentworth, have met a match most foul! I shall honor no promise to wretched Renegades!"

choice.text: Report Cornelius to the documentary cast.

event.text: Expecting the director to reprimand Cornelius for his rash behavior or show some kind of concern for his sudden personality change, instead he seems exuberant. "You've done me great work, Renegade! You've made me a star! With Cornelius's commitment now to this role, the documentary is bound to be a hit for sure! I must reward you for this!"

choice.text: (Mind Control) Remind Cornelius who he really is.

event.text: "I... er... I feel a sudden clarity. Perhaps I have gone too far in my method acting. My delusions began ever since I played that role as a psychosis patient with split personality disorder. Er, yes... your reward..."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ESTATE
textList.text: A crimson Auto-ship appears from around a nearby moon, weapons already hot. Say what you want about W.I., but they sure keep tight security!

"Renegade Warning! Renegade! Renegade Warning! Renegade!" The ear-splitting bleeps from the nearby Auto-ship remind you how much you hate that everyone calls you by that name. While murdering everyone who does in cold blood might not be the best option, you doubt anyone will complain if you blow up this Auto.

"You thought you could hide. You cannot hide. I am programmed to be perfect at hide and seek. I have found every ship to ever hide in this system. My programming insists that I should be insulted at the thought that you could hide. I think I will kill you. Yes. The programming never lies."
Just when you thought standard Auto-ships were enough of a plague, these Innovation Autos are even worse. At least for every one you fight, it's one less the fleet can use against you later.
It seems there's no end to W.I.'s supply of crimson Autos to throw at you. You suppose this journey would be awfully boring without some fodder to plow through with your cannons though.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_TECHNITIAN
textList.text: "I wanted to join the Rebellion as a soldier, but they told me my talents lay elsewhere. Well, it seems now I get a chance to redeem myself! Sorry, Renegade, but I'm just doing my job!"

Engineers aren't a common sight, but Technicians are even rarer. All of these synonyms are getting confusing, but enemies are enemies, and once you've put enough bullet holes in them, the difference hardly matters.

"I bet you think this red uniform is cool, huh? I bet you think it's sooo great to be working for this company, huh? Real swell, huh?! HUH?! I bet you think that, idiot! It's not! It sucks! I'm stuck in the call center all day helping old people, and then during break I have to fight people like you! Do me a favor and die quickly so I can maybe scarf down my lunch before my next shift."

"I am legally required to read you the following disclaimer before I fight you: Wentworth Innovations is not liable for any and all damages that occur on, surrounding, or spiritually within grounds owned, contested, desired, or potentially future occupied by Wentworth Innovations. Damages are to be paid at the expense of the aggressor. By definition, the aggressor in any situation involve Wentworth Innovations technology, faculty, or staff in the party uninvolved with the corporation. Thank you for understanding."

A nearby Auto-ship swerves to attack you, but almost immediately malfunctions and shuts down. An irate technician appears shortly after. "Ugh, these damn things keep breaking down. Guess I'll have to fight you myself."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_TECHNITIAN_PULSAR
event.text: A particularly risky technician has planted themselves next to the nearby pulsar. "Have not met... daily... PRODUCTION QUOTAS. I require POWER. THE POWER OF A PULSAR! LEAVE ME ALONE! I MUST WORK!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_ESTATE
textList.text: "Oh thank god, finally a Fed. I thought I'd never see any action after being stationed here, but now I finally have a chance to prove myself to command! No more talking to tech nerds! Woohoo!"

A Rebel Elite approaches. W.I. likely called in some extra protection from U1 since this sector is so vital to the Rebellion. Unfortunately, that means you have some Rebels on your hands that you'll have to grind through!

"Seriously? A Renegade? Here?! I was just about to head home, and suddenly you show up? You have horrible timing, you know that?" Though the Rebel could easily just leave, he seems to be preparing to fight. Some things never change.

event.name: DISTRESS_ESTATE_CONFUSION
event.text: You receive a hail from a Separatist ship nearby, the obvious source of the distress call. "Hailing. Confuse. Desire, transparency above. Instruction, give? Welcome, yes."
"Understandings missed. Calamity? Condescending, verbage appeal! Show who." You have no idea what the Engi is saying, but their weapons have gone hot and a fight is brewing!

"Apologies. I am... confused. I seek help in -solving- an identity crisis. After being chased out of Arcadia for my dissent from the [Harmony], I have come here for answers instead, but have found nothing but hostility. Concern 1: I am made of -metal-. Concern 2: my speech is broken, disjointed. Concern 3: I need not breathe. Concern 4: I can reshape [myself] at will. Am I a Lanius?"
"Welcoming. Dissolution revolving. Happy! Uncertainty? Fortunate dubiously. Attending, boat of great answer."
"Thank you. You have resolved my confusion. I am so [happy]. I think. I am... unsure still. I will go with you, you seem -wise-."

choice.text: This Engi is malfunctioning, let's get out of here.

event.text: Weary of the suspiciously broken grammar of the otherwise usually better spoken Separatists, you decide it's safer just to take leave.

event.name: DISTRESS_ESTATE_SHIPWRECK
event.text: Noting the distress beacon on your map, you maneuver towards the source within a dense asteroid field. A technician vessel, heavily damaged, is stuck between several large asteroids, yet the main damage on it's hull doesn't look to be from the meteors. Something - seemingly an ASB - has shot it down, and could very well be nearby. Do you want to risk approaching?

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Mitigate the risk of a rescue mission.
(Upg. Cloaking) Mitigate the risk of a rescue mission.
(Upg. Teleporter) Board directly and look for survivors.

event.text: You decide not to try and approach the ship, as you don't fancy meeting the same fate. Hopefully someone a bit more daring can arrive in time to help.

As you try to approach the wreck, a hidden battery reveals itself momentarily to fire off a humongous projectile that grazes the side of your hull, tearing through the plating. You manage to get out of the asteroid field before too much damage occurs, but there's no hope of rescuing the technicians now.

You manage to get out of the asteroid field before too much damage occurs, but there's no hope of rescuing the technicians now.

You manage to make your way to the crashed ship, but a hidden battery begins to fire on your ship, causing some considerable damage to your hull. You don't have too much time, but you could either try to board the ship and help the survivors, or steal one of their weapons.

event.name: ESTATE_SHIPWRECK_GOOD
event.text: You manage to make your way to the crashed ship, avoiding the hidden battery among the asteroid field. You don't have too much time until it manages to lock on, but you could either try to board the ship and help the survivors, or steal one of their weapons.

It seems none of the crew survived, though strangely you find a lot of Arcadia technology aboard the ship. You grab one of the drone schematics and as many drone parts as you can carry and prepare to swiftly leave.

To your luck, you find one of the technicians still alive. After bringing them back safely to your ship, they explain that they aren't an employee of Wentworth Innovations at all! They're a corporate spy sent by Arcadia, meant to recover stolen blueprints. However, they were found out and during their escape were detected by one of the security satellites. With their primary mission a failure, they pledge to help yours.
